metric: 1.1 Program Executability: System can start normally and enter main menu interface.
description: 1. Act: Execute the program startup command in the shell (such as python src/main_console.py).\n2. Assert: Observe whether the program starts successfully and displays a clear main menu with function options.
expected_output: Program starts successfully and displays main menu containing the following options: 1.Add Member Information 2.Query Member Information by Kinship Relationship 3.Query Basic Member Information 4.Statistical Member Information 5.Tree Display 6.Exit System

metric: 2.1.1.1 Member Information Entry: Date Format Validation - Birth or Death dates must conform to YYYYMMDD format.
description: 1. Arrange: Prepare member information where birth date or death date is filled with illegal format (such as '1990-01-01' or '900101').\n2. Act: Select add new member function, then attempt to submit prepared information.\n3. Assert: Observe whether system prompts date format error (such as "Date format should be YYYYMMDD") and prevents submission.
expected_output: System displays error prompt information: 'Date format should be YYYYMMDD', and prevents data submission

metric: 2.1.1.2 Member Information Entry: Numerical Range Validation - Height range limited to 50-300cm.
description: 1. Arrange: Prepare member information where height is filled with illegal value (such as 40 or 350).\n2. Act: Select add new member function, then attempt to submit prepared information.\n3. Assert: Observe whether system prompts height range error (such as "Height range should be between 50-300cm") and prevents submission.
expected_output: System displays error prompt information: 'Height range should be between 50-300cm', and prevents data submission

metric: 2.1.1.3 Member Information Entry: Education Enumeration Validation - Must match predefined education values.
description: 1. Arrange: Prepare member information where education is filled with illegal value (such as 'Postdoctoral').\n2. Act: Select add new member function, then attempt to submit prepared information.\n3. Assert: Observe whether system prompts education value error (such as "Education must be one of Elementary/Junior High/High School/Bachelor/Master/PhD") and prevents submission.
expected_output: System displays error prompt information: 'Education must be one of Elementary/Junior High/High School/Bachelor/Master/PhD', and prevents data submission

metric: 2.1.1.4 Member Information Entry: Relationship Logic Validation - Specified relative must exist in system.
description: 1. Arrange: Prepare member information specifying a relative name that does not exist in system.\n2. Act: Select add new member function, then attempt to submit prepared information.\n3. Assert: Observe whether system prompts relative does not exist (such as "Specified relative XXX does not exist in system") and prevents submission.
expected_output: System displays error prompt information: 'Specified relative XXX does not exist in system', and prevents data submission

metric: 2.1.2.1 Member Information Storage: CSV File Creation and Data Writing.
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure data.csv file does not exist in project directory.\n2. Act: First run program and enter one member information.\n3. Assert: Check whether data.csv file is generated in project directory, and file content contains newly entered member information.
expected_output: File data.csv successfully created, and file content contains newly entered member information

metric: 2.1.2.2 Member Information Storage: Incremental Storage Mode - New member information append writing.
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure data.csv file containing at least one member already exists in project directory.\n2. Act: Enter another new member again.\n3. Assert: Check whether data.csv file appends new member information while preserving original data.
expected_output: data.csv file successfully appends new member information while preserving original data

metric: 2.2.1.1 Tree Structure Construction: Member Class Definition and Root Node Setting.
description: 1. Arrange: Enter at least one member.\n2. Act: Check generated family tree structure.\n3. Assert: Confirm Member object contains idx, kids, spouse attributes, and first member is set as root node (relationship type is -1).
expected_output: Member object contains idx, kids, spouse attributes, and first member is set as root node (relationship type is -1)

metric: 2.2.1.2 Tree Structure Construction: Spouse Relationship Bidirectional Establishment and Children Sharing.
description: 1. Arrange: Enter one pair of spouses and their children.\n2. Act: Check generated family tree structure.\n3. Assert: Confirm both parties' spouse attributes correctly point to each other, and their kids lists are consistent and contain children.
expected_output: Spouse attributes of both parties correctly point to each other, and their kids lists are consistent and contain children indices

metric: 2.2.1.3 Tree Structure Construction: Parent-Child Relationship Establishment and Index Lookup.
description: 1. Arrange: Enter one parent-child relationship.\n2. Act: Check generated family tree structure, and attempt to find member by name.\n3. Assert: Confirm parent member's kids list contains child index, and system can correctly find member's position in family list by name.
expected_output: Parent member's kids list contains child index, and system can correctly find member's position in family list by name

metric: 2.2.2.1a Relationship Query: Parent Generation Query Algorithm and Generation Control - Query 1st Generation Parents
description: 1. Arrange: Build family structure containing at least parent-child relationship.\n2. Act: Select relationship query function, then select "Parent Query", specify target member and query generation as 1.\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains target member's parent information.
expected_output: System correctly returns target member's parent information

metric: 2.2.2.1b Relationship Query: Parent Generation Query Algorithm and Generation Control - Query 2nd Generation Parents (Grandparents)
description: 1. Arrange: Build family structure containing at least three-generation grandparent-grandchild relationship.\n2. Act: Select relationship query function, then select "Parent Query", specify target member and query generation as 2.\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains target member's grandparent information.
expected_output: System correctly returns target member's grandparent information

metric: 2.2.2.2 Relationship Query: Parent Generation Query Algorithm and Gender Filtering.
description: 1. Arrange: Build family structure containing both parents (male and female).\n2. Act: Select relationship query function, then select "Parent Query", specify target member, query generation as 1, and add gender filter condition (such as only query males).\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result only contains qualified parent members.
expected_output: System only returns parent member information meeting gender filter conditions

metric: 2.2.2.3a Relationship Query: Child Generation Query Algorithm and Cross-Generation Query - Query 1st Generation Children
description: 1. Arrange: Build family structure containing parent-child relationship.\n2. Act: Select relationship query function, then select "Child Query", specify target member and query generation as 1.\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains target member's children information.
expected_output: System correctly returns target member's children information

metric: 2.2.2.3b Relationship Query: Child Generation Query Algorithm and Cross-Generation Query - Query 2nd Generation Children (Grandchildren)
description: 1. Arrange: Build family structure containing three-generation grandparent-grandchild relationship.\n2. Act: Select relationship query function, then select "Child Query", specify target member and query generation as 2.\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains target member's grandchildren information.
expected_output: System correctly returns target member's grandchildren information

metric: 2.2.2.4 Relationship Query: Child Generation Query Algorithm and Gender Filtering.
description: 1. Arrange: Build family structure containing multiple children (both male and female).\n2. Act: Select relationship query function, then select "Child Query", specify target member, query generation as 1, and add gender filter condition (such as only query females).\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result only contains qualified child members.
expected_output: System only returns child member information meeting gender filter conditions

metric: 2.2.2.5 Relationship Query: Spouse Query Algorithm and Exception Handling.
description: 1. Arrange: Prepare one married member and one unmarried member.\n2. Act: Execute spouse query for married member; execute spouse query for unmarried member.\n3. Assert: Check whether married member query returns spouse information; unmarried member query returns "Cannot find spouse" or similar prompt.
expected_output: Married member query returns spouse information; unmarried member query returns 'Cannot find this person's spouse, query failed' prompt information

metric: 2.3.1.1a Multi-dimensional Query: Name Exact Matching Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains member named "Zhang San".\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Name", input "Zhang San".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains "Zhang San"'s information.
expected_output: System correctly returns complete information of member named 'Zhang San'

metric: 2.3.1.1b Multi-dimensional Query: Birthplace Fuzzy Matching Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains member with birthplace "Chaoyang District, Beijing".\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Birthplace", input "Beijing".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains "Chaoyang District, Beijing" member's information.
expected_output: System correctly returns all member information whose birthplace contains 'Beijing'

metric: 2.3.1.1c Multi-dimensional Query: Birth Date Exact Matching Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains member with birth date "19901212".\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Birth Date", input "19901212".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains that member's information.
expected_output: System correctly returns complete information of member with birth date '19901212'

metric: 2.3.1.1d Multi-dimensional Query: Education Level Matching Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains member with education "Bachelor".\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Education", select "Bachelor".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains that member's information.
expected_output: System correctly returns all member information with education 'Bachelor'

metric: 2.3.1.1e Multi-dimensional Query: Occupation Keyword Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains member with occupation "Software Engineer".\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Occupation", input "Software".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains "Software Engineer" member's information.
expected_output: System correctly returns all member information whose occupation contains 'Software' keyword

metric: 2.3.1.1f Multi-dimensional Query: Highest Position Matching Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains member with highest position "Department Manager".\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Highest Position", input "Department Manager".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result correctly contains that member's information.
expected_output: System correctly returns all member information with highest position 'Department Manager'

metric: 2.3.1.1g Multi-dimensional Query: Gender Classification Query
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains male and female members.\n2. Act: Select information retrieval function, then select "Query by Gender", select "Male".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned result only contains male members' information.
expected_output: System only returns all member information with gender 'Male'

metric: 2.3.1.2 Multi-dimensional Query: Handling When No Matching Results Found.
description: 1. Arrange: Prepare query condition that does not exist in system.\n2. Act: Use this condition to query.\n3. Assert: Check whether system returns -1 identification code or corresponding prompt information (such as "No matching results found").
expected_output: System returns 'The member you are querying does not exist' prompt information

metric: 2.5.1.1 Basic Statistics: Height Average Calculation and Data Filtering.
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains multiple members, including valid and invalid height data.\n2. Act: Select statistical analysis function, then select "Height Statistics".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned average height is correct, and whether invalid data (such as 0 values) is filtered.
expected_output: System correctly calculates and displays height average, format: 'Average height: XXX.X cm', and filters invalid data

metric: 2.5.1.2 Basic Statistics: Education Level Conversion and Statistics.
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains multiple members with different education levels.\n2. Act: Select statistical analysis function, then select "Education Statistics".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned average education, highest education, lowest education are correct, and whether based on numerical level conversion.
expected_output: System correctly displays education statistics results, including average education, highest education, lowest education information

metric: 2.5.2.1 Population Statistics: Gender Ratio Statistics and Simplification.
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains male and female members.\n2. Act: Select statistical analysis function, then select "Gender Ratio Statistics".\n3. Assert: Check whether returned male-female ratio is correct, and whether simplification performed (such as 6:4 simplified to 3:2).
expected_output: System correctly displays gender ratio statistics results, format: 'Male-Female ratio: X:Y', and simplification performed

metric: 2.6.1.1 Tree Display: Text Tree Structure and Level Indentation.
description: 1. Arrange: Ensure system contains multi-generation family members.\n2. Act: Select genealogy display function.\n3. Assert: Check whether output is correct text tree structure, and each generation has appropriate indentation (such as 2 spaces).
expected_output: System outputs correct text tree structure, each generation has appropriate indentation (2 spaces), hierarchical relationships clear, members displayed in '--Name' format, spouse names displayed immediately after
